cellularAutomata.artificialLife.chromosome
Class BitChromosome

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.artificialLife.chromosome.BitChromosome
All Implemented Interfaces:
Chromosome
public class BitChromosome
extends java.lang.Object
implements Chromosome

The chromosome as a vector of bits. (Note that the BitSet class functions as a vector of bits.)

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

BitChromosome

public BitChromosome(java.util.BitSet bits,
                     int chromosomeLength)
Creates a chromosome from the specified vector of bits.

Parameters:
bits - The vector of bits used to build the chromosome.
chromosomeLength - The length of the chromosome.

BitChromosome

public BitChromosome(int chromosomeLength)
Creates a chromosome of the specified length. Internally, the chromosome is represented as a vector of bits. Each bit is randomly assigned a value of 0 or 1. For example, 001101011010 for a chromosome of length 12.

Parameters:
chromosomeLength - The length of the chromosome.

BitChromosome

public BitChromosome(java.lang.String bitString)
Creates a chromosome from the specified string of 0's and 1's. For example, 001101011010 for a chromosome of length 12.

Parameters:
bitString - A string of bits. For example, "001011010".
Method Detail

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Returns an exact copy of this chromosome. The clone will have a different pointer than the original.

Cloning is necessary when selecting chromosomes repeatedly for the next generation's population. Without cloning, an alteration to one Phenotype's chromosome could unintentially alter another Phenotype's chromosome (because they happen to be built from the same chromosome).

Specified by:
clone in interface Chromosome
Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A copy of the chromosome.

The length of the chromosome.

Returns:

setBit

public void setBit(int index,
                   boolean bit)
Sets the bit at the specified index to the specified value (true for a 1 and false for a 0).

Parameters:
index - The position of the bit being set.
bit - The value of the bit (true for a 1 and false for a 0).

toBigDecimal

public java.math.BigDecimal toBigDecimal()
Converts the chromosome to a BigDecimal. Note that long chromosomes may have bit representations that are too long for an int (32 bits), a long (64 bits) or a double (64 bits). Therefore, arithmetic on these chromosomes must be done with BigIntegers and BigDecimals that are capable of handling such large numbers.

Returns:
The BigDecimal represented by the chromosome's bits.

toBigInteger

public java.math.BigInteger toBigInteger()
Converts the chromosome to a Biginteger. Note that long chromosomes may have bit representations that are too long for an int (32 bits), a long (64 bits) or a double (64 bits). Therefore, arithmetic on these chromosomes must be done with BigIntegers and BigDecimals that are capable of handling such large numbers.

Returns:
The BigInteger represented by the chromosome's bits.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Converts the bits to a string such as "000101001100". The first bit is from the 0th index in the vector of bits (the BitSet) held by this class.

Specified by:
toString in interface Chromosome
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The bits as a string.
